New Records: Jamal Musiala became the Euro 2024 top-scorer with three goals, tying Georgia's Georges Mikautadze.
Germany secured their first major tournament knockout win since 2016, ending their group stage elimination in the last two World Cups and Euro 2020
Key Match Events: The match was delayed by 20 minutes due to a thunderstorm in the first half.
Joachim Andersen's close-range finish was disallowed for offside before he conceded a penalty converted by Kai Havertz in the 53rd minute.
Jamal Musiala scored a decisive goal in the 68th minute to secure Germany's place in the quarterfinals.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany started strongly, with Nico Schlotterbeck having a goal ruled out for a foul in the build-up.
Denmark struggled to create combinations and were lucky to avoid conceding early on.
The game was suspended in the 35th minute due to lightning and heavy rain.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany defender Antonio RÃ¼diger praised the team's dominant performance and said they were 'dominant from the start'.
Ralf Ibing highlighted the team's resilience and confidence moving forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Signal Iduna Park in Dortmund, Germany, with an attendance of 61,612.
The game was covered by FOX and featured a line of GER -0.5 and an over/under of 2.5.
Others: The match was Germany's first Euro knockout win since 2016, marking a significant milestone for the team.
